Reviews.Title: Probably better alternatives out there.
Reviews.Author: D. MCKICHAN
Reviews.Content: I purchased this several months ago and used it quite a bit (gently) until it broke after about a month or two of use (sensor had trouble with light processing and final photos were bad). Although I found that I had to dig in order to find Kodak's customer service number, once I spoke to someone they were helpful. I did have to pay my own shipping to get it sent in for repairs, but that whole process went extremely quickly. I would give them high markes for fixing what was broken and my three star rating does not reflect any bad feeling about the fact the camera stopped working correctly so soon after purchase.  The camera itself was OK, but not outstanding. I found 12mp looked exactly the same as several of the lower mp choices and about the same as my older 5mp fuji. At least for what I do with a camera the 12mp didn't equate to anything. The HD video mode, which was the main reason I picked up the camera, was only so so. Outdoors it was fine, but did not handle bright whites well at all and displayed a purple streak from white objects. Indoors the video was very noisy. (In fairness though, even mid range consumer camcorders in the $400-$1000 range display noise indoors if you are not using a dedicated light.)Pros: small size, good LCD screen, HD video is better then the 640x480 that most cameras shoot but don't expect anything approaching broadcast quality.Cons: proprietary battery that I couldn't get off ebay yet, digital image stabilization not the equivalent of mechanical, only a 3x optical zoom, pics just average.

Reviews.Title: A Great Camera, at a great price
Reviews.Author: Victor C.
Reviews.Content: I have to start by letting you know im not a professional photographer, im just a person who wants to take good pictures, and decent video, with one small device that you can carry in your pocket.And that's exactly what makes this camera worth the money, what other camera will give 12mp images, and 16:9 video at 720p, for $180?Yes when you take a picture, it takes a few seconds (3-4) for the image to be processed before you can take another one, so know this, if you want to picture a moving object you better use the burst mode, cause you only get 1 shot.Video is great, and you can actually take stills out of the video, resolution is awesome (720p for a point & shoot!).Other manufactures will offer you great pictures, but horrible video quality, and if you buy a video camera you get great video but 1mp or vga pictures, this bad boy gives you the best of both worlds, on a small handy camera, at half the price.This camera is definitely a lot of bang for your buck

Reviews.Title: Sleek!
Reviews.Author: Noms Services Ltd "Noms"
Reviews.Content: It was sleek and lovely. The only thing I continue to wonder is why the manufacturers didnt add an AC charger just like in the 10MP. This is funny! I had to charge on my computer. I was lucky I had a G600 printer which I also used to charge. I finally had to order the charger saperately which am using to charge it now. The charger was lovely, as it can be dismantled and fixed again.For videos you want to review on the camera, the camera volume may disappoint you, as it is no loud enough. The image quality is however fantastic. Pictures I taken with this camera have not been a bad idea at all, and the camera's shutter speed is impressive, incomparable to any other Kodak camera I have ever used or come across. The only visible problem you have to cope with is the rate at which pictures blurr. You have to keep your hand real steady to get a clear pic.If you are the type that likes sleek things, this one is definitely for you.I would recommend it for upgrading by Kodak. I also suggest that they retain the shape and improve on my complaints. But, judging from the price, this camera is not a bad idea at all!

Reviews.Title: I love this camera
Reviews.Author: David Krueger "Montana Boy"
Reviews.Content: This is actually the second time I have bought this camera.  I ruined my first one on my trip in Hawaii when it was in my swim trunk pocket and it got wet when helping a man dock his boat.  I loved it so much that I bought another here on Amazon which had a better pirice then the first one I bought.  It's the best camera and the 12 mega pixels are incredible along with the HD video.  I would recommend this for anyone who wants to take the best quality pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Henry "PingPongPalace"
Reviews.Content: I bought this one a month ago. It is really a good one ($129 from Amazon).The picture is great and the HD video is amazing. Kodak has the best color in its category. The one I got already has the latest firmware. You need to download VCL player to play the video. Quicktime is bad to play the HD video

Reviews.Title: Dissapointing
Reviews.Author: Just Jen "'Twas blind but now I see."
Reviews.Content: I did alot of research before finally choosing this camera. The price seemed right, it had extremely high megapixels, and was compact in size. It seemed perfect.Upon reiceiving it, I was immediately wary. It was sluggish. I found that after taking a picture, when I pushed to review it, sometimes it would take 20 -30 seconds to load. Then it would freeze. The pictures were often grainy or blurry. I hoped that maybe with continued use, it might begin to work better- but it didn't. As the weeks went on, it froze more and more.One month after my purchase, it broke entirely. I took it to the beach and kept it in a zip lock bag, and placed it inside a waterproof sling. The next day, it didn't turn on. I sent it into Kodak to get it looked at in hopes of the warranty kicking in. I was charged a large sum for the inspection, then told that there was some sand in it. To get it fixed it would cost a hundred dollars, in which I had already spent 50 for them to look at it.I have a Kodak z760 that is amazing. I had thought to upgrade with this camera. However, my 6 megapixel took far better pictures than this one ever did. Its been very durable, I've taken it to the beach, my sister has dropped it, its been wet, and it has never failed. This camera was always very slow, the pictures were not quality

Reviews.Title: smart purchase
Reviews.Author: Jose Rafael M. Lemus "chepo mojica"
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera, compact but it has all the features i was looking in a digital camera.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: M. Boyett "Food Police"
Reviews.Content: My husband is the gadget guy, but I love this camera.  It has so many features.  We upgraded to this camera and it was worth it.  Great pictures.  Good price for features too.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easyshare V1233 12.1MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: M. d
Reviews.Content: Great total price of  $206.99 from Beach Camera The camera works great. Takes great pictures.The price is great for 12mp. Remember the price. So don,t complain about things this camera is missing. You pay more you get more.But over all this camera is great. Oh did I say great to much.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful Camera, any issues are User Related
Reviews.Author: William J. Higgins IV "Assault Man"
Reviews.Content: I've owned this for just over a week now, and have found it to be everything I'd expected, for the price, an amazing deal...

Reviews.Title: Replaced broken camera
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline Hehli
Reviews.Content: This camera was the model of my favorite camera which I dropped and broke.  I was so happy to find it and for such a good price.  It arrived in good condition and is working well.

Reviews.Title: buy a cannon!
Reviews.Author: tv
Reviews.Content: Crap!  picture quality is very low. Its suppose to be 12mp. wrong! really leave this camera alone. totally disapointment all away around. Video is 1980 vhs quality at best. Cannon or nikon is a way better choice. kODAK IS GREAT FOR FILM, HEY wait, its 2013! no one uses film anymore! Just like this camera, kodak is dead.

Reviews.Title: Didn't work
Reviews.Author: Susan N. Behme
Reviews.Content: This camera only worked for a few months.. then started failing the the previous one that I purchased new. Disappointed

Reviews.Title: Lil pile of JUNK!
Reviews.Author: Roger Herman
Reviews.Content: Bought this camers cause "Kodak" said its the "cats meow" had it long enough to let the so called warranty run out. 1st problem was wouldent hold a charge,sent it in and paid big $$ for the repair, (coulda bought a new camera for the cost) had it for 3 weeks and then the thing started doing the same thing,barely turning on or off so the lens moves alil.Well long story short...some lucky fisherman might hook a ol camera out of our town pond one day,, and who knows maybe it will work better then..SAVE YOUR MONEY!!

Reviews.Title: Mediocre for a 12 MP Camera
Reviews.Author: Persian Poetess
Reviews.Content: I received this camera as a gift and a upgrade from a lower pixel Nikon I owned.  My issue with my old camera was the minor graininess of pictures and its poor battery life.  When I initially started testing this camera, I was very happy with it and the preview window indicated some great shots at first glance.  It was not until I loaded up my pictures to the PC that the rain started coming down on my parade.Pictures usually come out blotchy with no real sharpness to them.  Often times in low light settings you will notice distinct red scan lines that ultimately ruin the shot.  If you do not hold the camera poker still, you will have images that are shaken and out of focus.  The saddest part is, when changing to different picture modes or adjusting settings to help correct these issues, nothing is really improved.The brighter spots regarding this camera is its ease of use, light weight, and auto-adjustment feature.  The problem with these conveniences are that the first two aren't biggies to me and the auto-adjustment does not kick in significantly enough to help a shot. Plus it makes my subjects squint their eyes as the green circle shining on their faces distracts them.  At the end of the day, I'm thinking of going back to my old Nikon or buying a new digital camera eventually.

Reviews.Title: Very Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Linda
Reviews.Content: I rarely use my camera...maybe about 5 occasions in a year. It's broken after 2 years.  I called the service center. The customer service was rude & obnoxiuos. Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera
Reviews.Author: Zubair Khalid
Reviews.Content: I have had several digital cameras. But i have to give V1233 5 stars rating for it durability, picture quality, battery life, specially 720P HD video. It takes SD card. SD cards have become universal now and very affordable.  I like this camera so much I have ordered another one because on an event like birthday's i want to take pictures and videos at the same time. For the price and quality this camera has exceeded my expectations. I used to carry two cameras whenever went on vacation or site seeing, handy cam and digital. V1233 has replaced both. I had to convert hadnycam videos to dvd for easy viewing, but V1233 videos I put them directly on my MediaCeter Computer which is hooked to my plasma tv, no conversion needed. I have dropped this camera on concrete surface and it still works.CON: only flaw I have noticed in two years since i had this camera that in low light if you zoom in an object and take picture it gets darker picture, if you zoom out picture is fine.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, great value, better than others
Reviews.Author: H. Savannah "willfindyoubargains"
Reviews.Content: I have read the other reviews of this camera & found it odd that the things others are complaining about are exactly what I loved about my Kodak V1233.  I am a photography student as well as an avid photographer.  I received the Kodak Easyshare as a gift & absolutely loved it!  I'm not sure of the exact settings I used, but I thought it took excellent photographs in dark environments, in florescent lighting, and other very poor lighting conditions.  Of course, the pictures were basically perfect when the lighting conditions were perfect, but I always achieved great results even with poor lighting.  It amazed me that I was able to take pictures no matter what the conditions were without changing barely any settings.  I've never had these results with any other camera & have owned many different brands (including Sony, Nikon, Fuji, and Kodak).Unfortunately for me, my son dropped the camera at a birthday party & it cost over $70 plus shipping costs for me to send it back to Kodak to fix because it wasn't under warranty.  I had the camera for about 2 1/2 years before this happened (with no problems I might add).  I then purchased another camera exactly like my old one on Craigs List, but unfortunately for me, the screen was broken by the time I received it.  I thought this must be a sign that I shouldn't purchase another one.  It has always been a dream of mine to own a Nikon camera, but didn't think I could afford one.  I purchased one on ebay (the Nikon Coolpix 10MP) and wish every single day that I still had my Kodak V1233.I develop tons of pictures every month (over 250) and was never disappointed when I picked up my prints with the Kodak camera.I do agree with the other reviews that it is slighty inconvenient that the camera can only charge via a USB port on your computer.  I have a laptop & it takes forever to load & everytime I wanted to charge my camera, I would have to wait 10 or 15 minutes before actually connecting it.  I did end up purchasing a charger online, but it wasn't a Kodak brand and it turned out breaking within a few months (because the prongs on the electrical portion were junk).Overall, I think this camera is great for beginners or for anyone who loves photography.  You have the option of using all automatic settings (for beginners) or you can mess with the settings & find what you like (for more advanced photographers).

Reviews.Title: Review of Kodak Easyshare V1233 HD Camera
Reviews.Author: Boyd
Reviews.Content: Excelent camera.  Great high def photos and video.  Simple to use.  Wish the video file format (Quicktime **.mov) was easier to edit and to convert for use in other media.

Reviews.Title: Really awful camera
Reviews.Author: Gideon'smom*of*4
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera since may of last year(2008)and have had nothing but problems with it.  Takes really blurry pics in auto mode and I have to manualy set it to take a clear pic.  Then the lense stopped retracting when I would turn it off and now it will not even charge or turn on at all.  Even before it refused to charge it would just shut off and not work even when fully charged.  To top it off you have to pay to get it shipped in to be repaired.  I've just ordered a new camera because I'm tired of dealing with all the problems.  My 2 mega pixel camera took better pics.  The software is also a pain.  I'll never own another kodak again.  Many great memories have missed out on being captured due to this crappy camera!

Reviews.Title: Kodak is wonderful
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I love Kodak cameras! Before I bought this one I had a V1033 and it took the best pictures! After I dropped it for the 300th time the lcd screen finally cracked so I knew I had to get another Kodak, they are the only cameras I trust, they last the longest and they have the best color quality! This camera is sleek and compact, but it packs a punch. It takes amazing hd videos if that's your thing, with 12mp every picture is crisp, as with all cameras it takes a little while to get use to with the auto focus and all the different settings, I bought a 16 gig memory card and at 12mp it holds 5000 pictures, it was totally worth it because it was only about [...] bucks. I dont like Kodak's software so I never install it. The camera comes with a rechargeable battery pack which is awesome but it only allows you to charge it though your USB port, luckily my V1033 came with a charger and it works for this camera too, so I would probably buy a charger from Kodak if you dont have one. I would recommend this camera to anyone who loves what Kodak offers and wants an amazing point and shoot for a great price! TOTALLY WORTH IT!!

Reviews.Title: Could have been much, much better
Reviews.Author: Michael Ryan
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for about a year now, and after using it for some time I have concluded that this camera is not worth the price. If you aren't outside, photos look more like an oil painting. While image quality is poor, videos are somewhat decent: HD video is a big plus, and what originally sold me on this camera. However, if I had to make the decision all over again, I wouldn't buy this.

Reviews.Title: Ok, but...
Reviews.Author: Mary E Gambino "Moi~"
Reviews.Content: After reading many good reviews for this camera, I decided to purchase it. I'm a sucker for good design, and the 12 megapixel with HD video were features i couldn't resist.Outside, on extremely sunny days, the pictures are excellent. Razor-sharp detail, perfect coloring, ect... but on cloudy days or indoors, the pictures turned out blurry and shaky 9/10 times. Sure there's a flash, but that only works for close-up subjects. Outdoors, when using flash on a subject, say, across the street, the pictures are almost completely black, and wastes battery unnecessarily.Close-ups on things like flowers and stuff are beautiful, but it isn't the best camera for taking pictures of people. You have them pose, you take a picture without the flash, you wait to find the colors are completely washed out. You turn off flash, you take the picture, you wait, only to find the picture extremely blurry. The whole process takes so long that the people you're taking a picture of get angry and annoyed at you.Lots of time, the video quality was better than the actual picture quality with flash off.Mostly, this camera is good, like freaky good. Its like a microscope. Yet it falls pretty darn short when taking pictures with the flash off...That is unless I'm doing something wrong, and believe me when I say I've tried everything i could think of.

Reviews.Title: It's 'okay' for a Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: K. O'Rourke
Reviews.Content: I thought I'd review this camera now that I've had it for almost a year.  It's okay.  Not the greatest camera out there.  The picture quality if really good when using the flash and in Auto focus.  You do need a steady hand in order to not have blurry pictures.  My biggest issue thus far is that I CANNOT for the life of me get clear pictures without using the flash.  I wanted to take pictures in a darker setting to get Christmas lights, but the settings such as candlelight or fireworks, or other nighttime settings just don't cut it.  The pictures are grainy, blurred, and too dark.  I also have a 15 month old and it's very difficult getting a non-blurred shot of her at times.If you are into landscape scenes, taking pictures of flora, etc. where the scenery basically doesn't move, then you can definitely get really nice pictures.As for the video, it's not bad.  I haven't had any issues with the sound or the picture.  Both are pretty clear.One other issue I've had is that there have been times where the camera has gotten stuck to where it's not really off or on.  Usually this would happen if the battery needs charged, but when it's happened to me, the battery was fully charged.Anyhow, I rated this three stars.  I think that you can probably find a better camera than this.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: Super Skirts "Superskirts"
Reviews.Content: Every time someone sees that I have a camera with 12 mp they ask, oh my goodness, how good is it?? I've never seen a camera with 12 mp! Well, I tell them, for less than 200$, I got what I paid for, which was a camera that takes still shots EXTREMELY well.  So, well that I actually have had still shots of flowers and birds that people want me to frame.  Moving shots are a lot harder, but I am going to keep experimenting with it and I'm sure I'll grow to love it more as I'm familiar with it's specs.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: K. Brown
Reviews.Content: The pictures are clear and the video in HD are on the money, highly recommend this cam to anyone looking for a easy to use and not to expensive camera. Kodak got down a little bit on this HD camera!

Reviews.Title: Awesome for the ameteur photographer
Reviews.Author: C. Burcky "80s fanatic"
Reviews.Content: This camera is really easy to use, great for beginning photographers. It's also pretty small and lightweight. Not the smallest I've seen, but it's definitely up there. The picture quality is excellent, not grainy or anything. Keep in mind that I am a novice, so I don't know any really detailed specifics, but what I do know, I definitely like!Overall, I feel that the Kodak Easyshare V1233 12.1MP Digital Camera is the perfect trade-off between price and quality. It's definitely the cheapest you'll find for a camera with so many megapixels!

Reviews.Title: Very nice camera
Reviews.Author: DT "SPL"
Reviews.Content: Had this camera for 2 months. I am very happy with this little camera. It takes nice 720p HD videos flawlessly.  Like most cameras, better lighted areas = better looking videos.  I've taken many pictures set at only 2 MP and videos set at High Quality 720p HD.  I have shown the pictures and videos on HDTV LCDs taken from this camera to my friends and they are really amazed. My friends $300 - $400 cameras only do 680x480 videos where as my Kodak camera does 1280x720. I don't have any problems charging my camera via PC or Laptop. The battery life is good, I only charge it once a week.Overall, I love this Kodak camera, it take nice pictures and HD videos. Going on trips got easier because I do not have to bring my bulky Panasonic 40GB hdd camcorder which only take 640x480 videos.

Reviews.Title: Excelent Product
Reviews.Author: Melissa Barragan Yani
Reviews.Content: this product complete my interest in a camera, i think that, if you have less money you can pay for this and aquire a good camera. i going to buy another for my parents, it`s soo good!!!!

Reviews.Title: fun camera
Reviews.Author: Melissa Braga
Reviews.Content: This camera is fun and easy to use. Uploading pictures to the computer just takes seconds

Reviews.Title: Great camera for price
Reviews.Author: Emily Smith
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace my boyfriend's xylifilm after the battery died after one year. So far, this camera has worked out great!

Reviews.Title: Grainy Pictures
Reviews.Author: Robin
Reviews.Content: I had the Kodak DX7630, it took excellent pictures.  I dropped it and broke the case so decided to go with Kodak again.  This time buying the V1233.  Indoor pictures were awful, blurry and grainy.  Outdoor shots were fine.  Returned the camera and bought a Canon.

Reviews.Title: Still in the ditch
Reviews.Author: Sarah
Reviews.Content: I purchased the V1233 December 19, 2007.Positives: Cheap for a purported 12 Mega Pixel Camera(Lens doesn't allow its 12 mega pixel rating to be effectively used in anything except the most ideal conditions)Negatives: (1)Lacks a useful printed manual.  (2)Very bad ergonomics.  Uncomfortable, heavy "pocket camera" with crowded buttons all over leaving little room to actually hold the camera.(3)Slow shot cycle even using HS SD memory.(4)Ineffective redeye reduction flash.(5) Ineffective antishake(6)AC charger was D.O.A. (7)1 hour and forty minute wait on the phone only to get poor customer service from Kodak.I remember when Kodak went in the poor design, poor quality, ditch a decade or so ago. I thought surely they had extricated themselves from that in the 10+ year interval since then. I was wrong. The ditch is now an abyss. Returned it today and happily bought a Fuji S700 that is twice the camera (even at 7 mega pixels) for less money.I will never go back to Kodak again, as they have now totally lost my trust. Too bad for a former giant to take such a fall and then chose to remain down on the mat wallowing over customers who try to return as patrons.  I repeat, Never again!

Reviews.Title: This camera does not come with a charger??!!
Reviews.Author: Michelle B. "mgdjmb"
Reviews.Content: This camera does not come with a charger!  I find that absolutely unbelievable!  How can you sell a camera that runs with a rechargeable battery and you find out once you receive the camera that you have to buy it seperately?I am absolutely amazed ... so beware!  It doesn't even say on the packet ... I had to look at the instruction manual and it states, sold seperately.Hasn't anyone else had this problem?

Reviews.Title: poor
Reviews.Author: Whtspar
Reviews.Content: The first "camera" was not even in the box, so a replacement was shipped.  When we received the replacement it had been shipped from Amazon Returns Center, so we also returned the actual camera and the empty box in separate shipments with separate UPS tracking numbers.  We printed your return labels as you requested, but when it came time to issue us a refund for the camera that we shipped back to, you are not willing to issue us a refund for something that we returned back to you!!!  I am extremely disappointed with your company and at the present time we are disputing the charge, but you are fighting it.  I sent you an e-mail on 3/19/08 explaining this to you, but as of 5/17/08 I have not received a response from you.  I have not had a problem with your company until this purchase, but I am not willing to let the $176.11 be charged back to my account when I returned this item to you!!  If this is the way that you do business, then I will take mine elsewhere. I would like this problem resolved as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: Misleading Advertizing
Reviews.Author: R. Miller
Reviews.Content: The images on the screen for this product includes a tripod, memery card, card reader and camera case, but these items are not included in the package.  Per customer service, these items are intended to show possible accessories, but this is not clear and there are no links to these products.  Be careful!  I feel mislead.

ProductInfo.Features:
View your pictures in high definition on an HDTV
12 Megapixel Stills, Up to 4000x3000 resolution, MPEG 4 QuickTime HD 720p at 30 fps Video Capture, 640x480 VGA at 30 fps
Built-in 32MB - We recommend purchasing a 4GB SD or SDHC Memory Card for practical usage
3x optical zoom, 5x digital zoom, 37-111mm (35mm equiv.) F/3.4-5.3 lens
Shutter speed - 8-1/1200 seconds
ProductInfo.Name: Kodak Easyshare V1233 12.1MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Zoom (Black)
